content: a companion knitting pattern to short dog long dog a book of opposites by anna hrachovec published by feiwel & friends and available in bookstores now pattern details yarn worsted-weight yarn in a main color 10-50 yards depending on how short or long your dog will be and black or other contrasting colors for eyes nose and mouth sample yarn gnome depot fiber porcini worsted cascade 220 needles set of size 5 us 3 75mm double-pointed needles other supplies stuffing tapestry needle techniques knitting in the round on double-pointed needles i-cord finished size a short dog is about 2 5cm long a long dog can be as long as you like notes gauge isn t important just make stitches tight enough so that stuffing won t show through scrap yarn works great for this project in any weight just use a needle size that will give you a tight gauge abbreviations st s = stitch es dpn s = double-pointed needle s round s = round s k = knit yo = yarnover k2tog = knit two stitches together kfb = knit through the front and then the back of one stitch body worked back to front face embroidery with eye-color yarn embroider the eyes with work rear end and back leg holes two small vertical stitches for each placed on with the main color cast on 6 stitches and one side of the body close to the closed-up distribute them onto 3 dpns to work in a round stitches at the front tip if working 6 stitches on 3 dpns is difficult with nose-color yarn embroider a nose with for you try working round 1 like an i-cord another two small vertical stitches between and before distributing the stitches just below the eyes embroider a mouth with one small vertical stitch round 1 kfb 6 times 12 sts directly beneath the nose and two diagonal round 2 kfb k1 6 times 18 sts stitches pointing up from either side of the round 3 knit vertical stitch round 4 k2 yo k2tog k to end round 5 knit ears make 2 round 6 k14 k2tog yo k2 with the main color cast 4 stitches onto one dpn leaving a tail for attaching work middle you will work these stitches as an i-cord but for a short dog knit 2 rounds without pulling the yarn tightly when working the for a long dog knit 50 rounds pictured or first stitch of each row however many you like for as long of a dog as row 1 and 2 knit you like row 3 k2tog twice 2 sts break the yarn and draw it tightly through the work front leg holes and head stitches with a tapestry needle round 1 k2 yo k2tog k to end with the purl side facing forward stitch the cast- round 2 knit on edge of each ear to the body a few stitches round 3 k14 k2tog yo k2 back from an
